manipulated_prompt_obj.inputs:
<bos><start_of_turn>user
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow in the refrigerator, the book in the wardrobe and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a table, a chair and a couch. There is a passage to a hallway here.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model

raw_response_obj.response:
> look around
Next actions: Examine each object in the room (side table, table, chair, couch) to see if any of the items I need to move are present. Then, explore the hallway.

clem_player.response:
> look around
Next actions: Examine each object in the room (side table, table, chair, couch) to see if any of the items I need to move are present. Then, explore the hallway.

> look around

<start_of_turn>user
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model

raw_response_obj.response:
You are right to call me out on that! My apologies. I defaulted to a common adventure game convention. I will stick to more direct actions.

> go to hallway
Next actions: Explore the hallway to find the pillow, book, and plate. Once found, return to the living room and begin placing items in their correct locations (refrigerator, wardrobe, shelf).
